segments.lesson_summary: Summary of segment 5: When we look at a number, each digit has a value. For example, in the number 453, the digit 3 represents units, the digit 5 on the right represents tens, and the digit 5 on the left represents hundreds. So, if we take the number 453 and ask what is the value of the digit 3 in this number, we know that it represents a value of 3 units. Similarly, if we look at the number 55, the digit 5 on the right represents 5 units and the digit 5 on the left represents 5 tens. By understanding the value of each digit in a number, we can solve math problems and understand the different places and meanings of numbers. This concept is important in math and helps us with addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
